intro: Centaurea × bilbilitana var. paredensis, commonly known as the Paredes centaury, is a hybrid plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae, characterized by its spiky, blue to purple flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, bracteate flowers that are often visited by pollinators such as bees. This variety is of interest to botanists due to its unique hybrid origin and ecological adaptations.
